item.title: Shelley23 add a quote by Maya Angelou
item.description: "Out of the huts of history's shame I rise Up from a past that's rooted in pain I rise I'm a black ocean, leaping and wide, Welling and swelling I bear in the tide. Leaving behind nights of terror and fear I rise Into a daybreak that's wondrously clear I rise Bringing the gifts that my ancestors gave, I am the dream and the hope of the slave. I rise I rise I rise." -- Maya Angelou

item.title: Shelley23 add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "Friendship is the hardest thing in the world to explain. It's not something you learn in school. But if you haven't learned the meaning of friendship, you really haven't learned anything." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Shelley23 add a quote by Muhammad Ali
item.description: "Hating people because of their color is wrong. And it doesn't matter which color does the hating. It's just plain wrong." -- Muhammad Ali

item.title: Shelley23 add a quote by Mark Twain
item.description: "It's not the size of the dog in the fight, it's the size of the fight in the dog." -- Mark Twain
